Package pl.put.poznan.sorting.rest

Class SortingMadnessController

java.lang.Object
pl.put.poznan.sorting.rest.SortingMadnessController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/") public class SortingMadnessController extends Object
The SortingMadnessController class is a REST controller that handles HTTP requests for sorting operations using various algorithms. It accepts user-provided data and parameters, sorts the data accordingly, and returns the sorted result along with performance metrics. This class is designed to work with sorting tasks that involve multiple sorting algorithms and can handle different types of data (integers or JSON objects).

  • Method Details

    • post

      @PostMapping(produces="application/json") public String post(@RequestBody Map<String,Object> jsonMap)
      Handles POST requests for sorting data. The input JSON must contain the following fields:
      • to-sort - A list of integers or objects to be sorted. The data type depends on the presence of the field parameter.
      • algorithms - A list of sorting algorithm names (e.g., BubbleSort, QuickSort).
      • iterations - The maximum number of iterations to perform during sorting.
      • order - The sorting order (either "ascending" or "descending").
      • time-limit - The time limit in nanoseconds for the sorting operations.
      Optionally, the field parameter can be included if sorting JSON objects based on a specific field (e.g., sorting objects by an "age" field). Example request body for sorting integers: 
       {
     "to-sort": [5, 3, 8, 6, 2],
     "algorithms": ["BubbleSort", "QuickSort"],
     "iterations": 100,
     "order": "ascending",
     "time-limit": 1000000
 }
      Example request body for sorting JSON objects: 
       {
     "to-sort": [{"name": "Alice", "age": 30}, {"name": "Bob", "age": 25}],
     "algorithms": ["QuickSort"],
     "iterations": 50,
     "order": "ascending",
     "field": "age",
     "time-limit": 1000000
 }
      Parameters:
      jsonMap - a map containing the input parameters as a JSON object
      Returns:
      a JSON response containing the sorted data and time elapsed for each algorithm or an error message if the input is invalid
